tn.ref: I am about to teach you
tn.text: Moses is telling the people of Israel what God wants them to do.
"and obey them"

tn.ref: You will not add to the words ... neither will you diminish them
tn.text: Yahweh does not want his people to create new laws, or to ignore those he has already given them.
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
Here "eyes" refers to the people of Israel. AT: "You saw" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "because of the sins you committed at Baal Peor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Translate this as you did in  [[:en:bible:notes:deu:03:28|3:29]].

tn.ref: Yahweh your God has destroyed them from among you
tn.text: Moses speaks to the people of Israel as though they were one person, so "your" and "you" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
The writer speaks as if trusting in Yahweh and obeying him were like physically holding on to a person. AT: "you who were careful to obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
"Pay attention"

tn.ref: that you should do so in the midst of the land
tn.text: "that you should obey them when you live in the land"
These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that they are to obey them. AT: "obey them carefully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples
tn.text: The abstract nouns "wisdom" and "understanding" can be translated as adjective phrases, and the abstract noun "sight" refers to how the peoples judge or decide on the value of something. AT: "this is what will show the peoples that you are wise and that you understand what is important" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: this great nation is a wise and understanding people
tn.text: The word "nation" is a metonym for the people of that nation. AT: "the people of this great nation are wise and understanding" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: For what other great nation is there ... him? What other great nation is there ... today?
tn.text: These rhetorical questions can be translated as statements. AT: "For there is no other great nation ... him. There is no other great nation ... today." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Only pay attention ... guard yourself ... you do not forget ... your eyes ... your heart ... your life ... make them known to your children and your children's children ... you stood before Yahweh your God
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they are one person, so all instances of "you," "your," and "yourself," as well as the commands "pay attention," "guard," and "make known" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Only pay attention and carefully guard yourself
tn.text: "Pay careful attention and be sure to remember these things always"

tn.ref: you do not forget ... they do not leave your heart
tn.text: These phrases means the same thing and emphasize that the people of Israel must remember what they have seen. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here "eyes" are a synecdoche for the person. AT: "you have seen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Bring the people together and bring them to me"
Moses continues to remind the Israelites of their history.

tn.ref: with fire to the heart of heaven
tn.text: This is an idiom. "The heart of" means "the middle of" or "the innermost part of," and "heaven" here refers to the sky. AT: "with a fire that went up to the sky" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness
tn.text: Here "thick darkness" describes the cloud. AT: "with a thick, dark cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])
Another possible meaning is "heavy cloud."
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
"Yahweh declared"
Here "you" refers to the Israelites who were at Mount Horeb.

tn.ref: in the land that you are crossing over to take possession of
tn.text: "after you have crossed over the Jordan River and taken possession of the land"
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: So take great heed to yourselves
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "So you need to be very careful how you act" or 2) "Guard your souls carefully."
"do not do what is wrong"
"crawls on the ground"

tn.ref: You shall not lift your eyes ... and look ... and be drawn ... Yahweh your God
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" and the words "lift," "look," and "be drawn" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You shall not ... and be drawn away to worship
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do not ... and do not let anyone make you want to worship" or "Do not ... and do not allow yourself worship" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: all the host of the heavens
tn.text: "everything you can see in the sky." This is another way of referring to the sun, moon, and stars.

tn.ref: of which Yahweh your God has given a share all the peoples
tn.text: This is an idiom. Moses speaks of the stars as if they were small objects like food that Yahweh was dividing and giving out to the people groups. AT: "that Yahweh your God has put there to help all people groups" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: brought you out of the iron furnace
tn.text: Moses speaks of Egypt and the hard work the Israelites did there as if it were an oven in which iron is heated and the Israelites were the iron. AT: "brought you out of the land where people made you do hard work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: a people of his own inheritance
tn.text: This is an idiom that can be translated "people who belong only to him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Yahweh was angry with me because of you
tn.text: This refers to when Moses disobeyed what Yahweh told him to do because Moses was angry with the people of Israel. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:37|1:37]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Yahweh your God is giving to you
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"Pay careful attention"

tn.ref: Yahweh your God has forbidden you ... Yahweh your God
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one person, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Yahweh your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God
tn.text: Moses compares how Yahweh acts when he is angry to the way a fire destroys things. AT: "Yahweh your God will severely punish and destroy you like a fire does because he does not want you to worship other gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
The words "you" and "your" are singular here.
become the father of, or become the ancestor of
"if you do what is wrong." Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:15|4:16]].

tn.ref: and do what is evil in the sight of Yahweh your God, to provoke him to anger
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "and you make Yahweh your God angry by doing what he says is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I call heaven and earth to witness
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) Moses is calling on all those who live in heaven and earth to be witnesses to what he says or 2) Moses is speaking to heaven and earth as if they are people, and he is calling them to be witnesses to what he says. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: you will not prolong your days
tn.text: Long days are a metaphor for a long life. AT: "you will not be able to live a long time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: but you will be completely destroyed
tn.text: As indicated in 4:27, not every Israelite will be killed. Here "completely destroy" is hyperbole and emphasizes that many of the Israelites will die. AT: "but Yahweh will destroy many of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Yahweh will scatter you among the peoples
tn.text: Moses speaks as if the people were seeds that Yahweh would scatter around a field. AT: "Yahweh will send you to many different places and force you to live there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"will send you" or "will cause your enemies to take you away"

tn.ref: the work of men's hands, wood and stone
tn.text: Here "men's hands" refers the men themselves, and "the work ... wood and stone" to the idols that they have created. AT: "the wood and stone idols that men have made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel. He speaks as though they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"But when you are in those other nations"
The word "you" here is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"when you really try to find him" or "when you really try to know him"

tn.ref: with all your heart and with all your soul
tn.text: The idiom "with all ... heart" means "completely" and "with all ... soul" means "with all ... being." These two phrases have similar meanings. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"have happened to"
"afterwards" or "then"
Here "listen" means to hear and obey, and "his voice" refers to Yahweh and what he says. AT: "obey what he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and the command "ask now" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Did ever a people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and live?
tn.text: Here the people of Israel are reminded of how Yahweh has spoken to them in an amazing way in the past. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "No other people besides you has heard God speak from the middle of the fire and lived." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: hear the voice of God speaking
tn.text: The word "voice" is a metonym for God, who was speaking. AT: "hear God's voice as he spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: and by a mighty hand, and by an outstretched arm
tn.text: Here "a mighty hand" and "an outstretched arm" are metaphors for Yahweh's power. AT: "and by showing his mighty power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "eyes" refer to the whole person. AT: "in front of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: To you these things were shown
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh showed you these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he made you to hear ... made you see
tn.text: "he made sure you heard ... made sure you saw"

Moses speaks as if the people to whom he was speaking were the people he had spoken to at Mount Sinai many years earlier. The people at Mount Sinai were actually the fathers of the people to whom he was speaking these words. AT: "made your fathers ... your fathers heard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This refers to Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and Jacob's sons.

tn.ref: with his presence, with his great power
tn.text: "with the great power that comes from his presence" or "with his great power"
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is an idiom. AT: "remember it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in heaven above and on the earth beneath
tn.text: The two phrases "in heaven" and "on the earth" show two extremes and mean "everywhere." AT: "over everything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
Long days are a metaphor for a long life. AT: "be able to live a long time." Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:25|4:26]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses's speech, which began in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:05|1:6]], has finished, and the writer continues the narrative that ended in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:05|1:5]].
These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to the laws Moses will give in the following chapters.
This is the name of a town in Moab near Mount Pisgah. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:03:28|3:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"King Sihon ... Amorite people ... town of Heshbon." Translate these as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]].
King Sihon's land
Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]].

tn.ref: beyond the Jordan toward the east ... eastward beyond the Jordan
tn.text: This refers to the land across the Jordan River, to the east of Israel. Moses was east of the Jordan when he said this. AT: "from the side of the Jordan River toward the east ... eastward from the side of the Jordan River"
This is the name of a city. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:36|2:36]].
This is the name of a place. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:24|2:24]].
These are the names of mountains. Translate these as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:03:08|3:8-9]].

tn.ref: Sea of the Arabah ... Mount Pisgah
tn.text: Translate these as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:03:17|3:17]].
